intro: Hieracium dentatum subsp. pseudovillosum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges.
